title: Enhancing Medical Practice Competencies: Group Formation and Seating Strategies for Improving Classroom Peer Relationships

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: A signal detection theory-based assessment tool can be utilized to analyze friendship patterns among 5,852 learner pairs
Group formation strategies can be designed considering three core variables: gender, sociability, and teacher-student relationship similarity
A seating arrangement strategy can be implemented in VR simulations to measure alignment with student perceptions at over 80% accuracy

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
